text: Splice release 0.4.0 is ready for deployment on DevNet

text.text:
:tada: Splice release `0.4.0` is ready for deployment on DevNet, and is available from the GSF
:ship: ⅔ of Super Validator nodes have upgraded to this release, including the GSF Super Validator node
*SV node status here*: <https://sync.global/sv-network>
*Release notes here*: <https://docs.dev.sync.global/release_notes.html>

  updateId = 122028518fb51be59540236ab622814bb7594b0d1cd43cce8dfd2b229dc7bfef87df,

<@U03QSP8LP9T> is there a periodic task for the validator to do migration dumps every 30 mins or so and I just need to wait for this to show up?

```kubectl logs validator-app -f | grep "migration dump"```

text:
Hello, I’ve already sent an email to support, but sharing the issue here as well in case anyone can help sooner.
We’re seeing crashes on the mainnet validator:
 GSR-validator -1::1220b7cf823540407527405845a724a7624c3a5ffc5077a83bce5669b8df29588fe5
It was previously on 0.3.15 and still part of the latest round until recently, but is now failing.
Actions taken so far:
• Upgraded to 0.3.21
• Set CANTON_PARTICIPANT_AUTO_INIT=false
Errors observed:
On the validator:
 java.lang.RuntimeException: validator_backend app initialization: Initialize app failed
 Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: validator_backend app initialization: Vet packages failed
 Caused by: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNIMPLEMENTED: Method not found: com.digitalasset.canton.admin.participant.v30.PackageService/GetDar
On the participant:
 java.lang.IllegalStateException: Mediator approved a request that we have locally rejected
It seems the validator may be unable to update the splice DARs, but it does appear to be running the correct version. We received this confirmation:
 "Version verification passed for scan, server is on the same version as mine, or a compatible one: VersionInfo(0.3.21, 2025-04-17T08:39:03Z)"
Any help or suggestions would be appreciated.
Thanks!

elements.text:
Hello, I’ve already sent an email to support, but sharing the issue here as well in case anyone can help sooner.
We’re seeing crashes on the mainnet validator:
 GSR-validator -1::1220b7cf823540407527405845a724a7624c3a5ffc5077a83bce5669b8df29588fe5
It was previously on 0.3.15 and still part of the latest round until recently, but is now failing.
Actions taken so far:
Upgraded to 0.3.21
Set CANTON_PARTICIPANT_AUTO_INIT=false

Errors observed:
On the validator:
 java.lang.RuntimeException: validator_backend app initialization: Initialize app failed
 Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: validator_backend app initialization: Vet packages failed
 Caused by: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNIMPLEMENTED: Method not found: com.digitalasset.canton.admin.participant.v30.PackageService/GetDar
On the participant:
 java.lang.IllegalStateException: Mediator approved a request that we have locally rejected
It seems the validator may be unable to update the splice DARs, but it does appear to be running the correct version. We received this confirmation:
 "Version verification passed for scan, server is on the same version as mine, or a compatible one: VersionInfo(0.3.21, 2025-04-17T08:39:03Z)"
Any help or suggestions would be appreciated.
Thanks!

text: Hello. Did you check release notes from 0.3.15 to 0.3.21 for breaking changes ? I'm afraid that's a too big jump. Also, I don't find this flag CANTON_PARTICIPANT_AUTO_INIT in splice archive (which contains docs AFAIK)

elements.text: Hello. Did you check release notes from 0.3.15 to 0.3.21 for breaking changes ? I'm afraid that's a too big jump. Also, I don't find this flag CANTON_PARTICIPANT_AUTO_INIT in splice archive (which contains docs AFAIK)

text: Reminds me I have a patch pending for splice regarding wallet admin accounts that should be quoted when written to the config file (okta returns user emails, that breaks config files parsing if not quoted, so I actually use a hack : ' " email@address " ' in helm yaml, so the final value is quoted
